meanings.definition: To beat or defeat soundly in a competition or fight.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the team whooped their opponents with a big score.
meanings.sent2: The boxer whooped his opponent in the ring with his powerful punches.
meanings.sent3: The kids whooped the adults in the friendly soccer match.
meanings.sent4: She whooped her personal best time in the race, leaving everyone behind.
meanings.sent5: The champion whooped all challengers to retain the title.

meanings.definition: To make a loud cry or noise, especially in celebration or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The fans whooped with joy when their team scored a goal.
meanings.sent2: The children whooped happily as they played in the park.
meanings.sent3: The puppy whooped in delight when it saw its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The party guests whooped in excitement when the surprise was revealed.
meanings.sent5: The audience whooped in appreciation after the amazing performance.
